definition: to knock on the door/to take a shot on goal (sports)
to beat/to strike/to hit/to break/to type/to mix up/to build/to fight/to fetch/to make/to tie up/to issue/to shoot/to calculate/to play (a game)/since/from

gate/door/CL:扇[shan4]/gateway/doorway/CL:個|个[ge4]/opening/valve/switch/way to do something/knack/family/house/(religious) sect/school (of thought)/class/category/phylum or division (taxonomy)/classifier for large guns/classifier for lessons, subjects, branches of technology/(suffix) -gate (i.e. scandal; derived from Watergate)

sentences.english: When he opened it, the villagers stood outside.
sentences.chinese: 他打门开一看，村民们都站在外面。

sentences.english: I banged on the door until he let me in.
sentences.chinese: 我砰砰地打门，直到他们让我进去。

definition: (soccer, handball etc) to kick or shoot the ball towards the goal
corner kick (in soccer)/free strike in hockey
to burst or force open a door/to excommunicate sb (from the Roman Catholic Church)/to score a goal (in football, hockey etc)
to set up a teammate (with an opportunity to score)/to throw a game
an overhung door/a door that hinges upwards
